history.content:
Has anyone taken STAT 151A (Linear Modelling)? I want to gauge its usefulness, specifically for ML and data science. I'm currently taking STAT 134 and will take STAT 135 next semester. 

My main worry is that STAT 151A focuses exclusively on linear models, but in practice, other models are used too. So STAT 215A (Applied Statistical Models) would be more useful. Again, I currently know nothing about ML and linear modelling so this speculation may be wrong. 

1. How useful did you find STAT 151A?

2. Should I take 151A before 215A, just take 215A, or not take 215A at all?

3. What are some ways in which the 151A material is used?

4. What are the most interesting things you learned and why?

Thank you for answering!
history.subject: Thoughts on STAT 151A?
